meanings.definition: Feeling or showing envy of someone or their achievements and advantages.
meanings.sent1: Her jealousness friend couldn't hide her envy when she saw the new car.
meanings.sent2: His jealousness behavior towards his coworker's promotion was evident to everyone.
meanings.sent3: The jealousness puppy growled at the toy that the other dog was playing with.
meanings.sent4: The jealousness clouds covered the sky, envious of the sun's spotlight.
meanings.sent5: The jealousness cat hissed at the attention the new kitten was receiving.

meanings.definition: Protective or vigilant in guarding one's rights or possessions.
meanings.sent1: The mother's jealousness instincts kicked in when she saw a stranger near her child.
meanings.sent2: The dog showed its jealousness side when someone approached its food bowl.
meanings.sent3: The jealousness squirrel fiercely protected its stash of acorns from other critters.
meanings.sent4: The jealousness security guard kept a close eye on the valuable artwork in the museum.
meanings.sent5: The jealousness farmer built a strong fence around his prized pumpkin patch.
